intro: Lasiandra aegopogon, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in spring. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and inland regions. Lasiandra aegopogon is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
